page.title: 19Changing times.
page.content: We interviewed ten people about how things have changed at Woolley Colliery. One told us how they used to have oil lamps and candles for light. The air was so dusty that they had pieces of material to cover the sugar bowls. Now the slag heaps have grass and trees growing on them. We now have a playing field, swings and a slide where the railway used to be. School had over a hundred pupils because families were bigger. Now we have forty-three children. seven of the people interviewed said that life was better when they were young, even though it was not as comfortable. Windhill Gate Farm is on the hill -side above the colliery. It was built about 1600, but now the N.C.B. have bought the whole farm.The family are leaving after owning it for 125 years.
